newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Hong Kong welcomes Sino-US textile accord.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong welcomes Sino-US textile accord.

text.p: Hong Kong on Sunday welcomed the textile accord reached between its two largest trading partners, China and the United States, to avert a multi-million dollar trade war.
"The Hong Kong government welcomes the textiles agreement between China and the United States," a spokesman for the Government Information Service said.

Chinese and U.S. negotiators reached an agreement in Beijing to renew the 1994 textile accord and resolve a dispute over U.S. penalties on Chinese textile exports just hours before the deadline expired.
The Sino-U.S. textile pact had been scheduled to expire on December 31 but was extended by a month to give both sides time to hammer out a compromise.
Washington slapped $19 million worth of penalties on imports of Chinese textiles last September, saying Beijing was shipping textiles through third countries to evade quota restrictions.
China had threatened to retailate by temporarily banning imports of some U.S. textile, farm goods and alcoholic drinks but delayed such action to allow time for further talks.
